job_description:
Overview

At Intuit, our mission is to power prosperity for consumers and small businesses worldwide. The Developer Experience (DevX) Design team accelerates this mission by delivering next generation-platforms full of innovative and foundational experiences, tools, and services that enhance development velocity across TurboTax, QuickBooks, Mint, and Mailchimp. As a Design researcher on the Developer Experience (DevX) design team, you’ll help your team of Design, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll work with stakeholders across functions and levels and have an impact at all stages of product development. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products.

What You'll Bring

Bachelor's degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, related field, or equivalent practical experience
4 years of experience in an applied research setting or similar
Experience with research design utilizing various methods (e.g., usability studies, contextual inquiry, surveys, etc.)
Relevant product research experience, either in an end-to-end, usability, or generative setting

How You Will Lead

As a design researcher, your role is to assist your team of designers, product managers, and engineers in comprehending user needs.
You will collaborate with stakeholders from various functions and levels, and your influence will be felt throughout the entire product development process.
Your contribution will be crucial in designing products that are practical, easy to use, and enjoyable.
To better understand user behaviors and motivations, you will conduct primary research through a variety of methods, including interviews, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, and usability testing.
Perform comprehensive research independently on various aspects of products and experiences.
Gather and evaluate user behavior by conducting lab studies, ethnography, surveys, and benchmark studies.
Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and other Design researchers to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research
Present research findings to various audiences through written reports and in-person presentations.
